subject: Marketing
title: Central vs Peripheral Processing
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Central vs Peripheral Processing.

hook.text: A car ad shows crash-test data and fuel stats. Another shows a surfer at sunset.

buildup.text: Both sell the same car. But they target completely different mental processes.

discovery.text: Central processing engages logic. Peripheral processing engages feeling and association.

twist.text: Central persuasion lasts longer, but peripheral persuasion works much faster.

climax.text: The best campaigns layer both: a compelling story backed by one strong fact.

quiz.question: Which type of persuasion produces faster results?
options: Peripheral processing through feeling and cues
Central processing through logic and data
